characters: WHERE RAY WAS STANDING. SPARKS FLY
IN THE WINDOW OF THE BELL TOWER --
BEN'S HOOK IS ON HER FOOT
THE FISHERMAN CROUCHING UNDER HER BED
THE GLASS ROOF OF THE ORCHID HOUSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The setting sun backlights a series of abstract colored i images of STAINED GLASS and lead. FOOTSTEPS ECHO across the marble floor.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: A little older, a little wiser, yet still very pretty, no she's all alone in the house of the Lord. And those doleful eyes of hers clearly telegraph a very h still rests upon her soul. She reluctantly walks past the rows of empty pews toward CONFESSIONAL BOOTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie slides the drapes shut behind her as she enters, kn the CLOSED SCREEN. A beat -- and the SCREEN SLIDES OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: A PRIEST
dialogues.text: enters the adjacent booth -- barely visible through the W Julie looks down, crosses herself, and begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bless me, Father, for I have sinned. (a beat) It's been a year since my last confession...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie swallows hard. This is difficult for her. JULIE (cont'd) I've never told anyone this. Not my mom, not the poice, not even my friends -- except for the ones who were there and they...well they're not around anymore. You see I...I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I killed a man. Well, I thought I had...then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She balks at the memory of it. The priest bows his head i of the other side. JULIE (cont'd) (emotional) You've got to understand...It was all an accident. A terrible accident. It's been a whole year. I've tried to get past this, but I just can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have these dreams...horrible dreams. And this man is always there with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring) I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, he was a killer. He murdered Helen and Barry, and he would have killed me too, if I hadn't...gotten away with it. (regathering) I don't know, I guess I just need to deal with the fear, the guilt...to finally say his name. Ben Willis. His name was Ben Willis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The confession is cathartic for Julie. She looks relieved

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie stops. Looks through the screen. A chill shoots thr body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know? But how could you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clouds of icy steam shoot through the partition. Julie mo the screen, trying to get a better look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growls) I KNOW WHAT YOU DID LAST SUMMER!!!

dialogues.speaker: A STEEL HOOK
dialogues.text: smashes through the screen right in Julie's face! She SCR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still screaming -- Julie jumps back, seemingly knocked ou chair. She fights the unseen demon. Sitting beside her, Julie's friend WILL BENSON reacts. He looking kid in a shy, humble kind of way. And he tries to but she's too busy turning ten shades of red. The PROFESSOR lowers his glasses, makes it even worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you find Political Science so stimulating --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lecture hall erupts with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie grabs her stuff and bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie explodes out of the building. Hurries down a sidewa finally catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie! Wait! You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie realizes this is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had another dream, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes this seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shower again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was in a church...it was so real. I mean, I could feel his breath on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (caring) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was over the dreams for good. I really did. I hadn't had one for months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just takes time, Julie. It's gonna get better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't get worse. I mean, it's not like this was the first time I freaked out in class. I hardly ever get a full night's sleep, my grades suck, I'm this close from being thrown out of school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! EXPLOSIONS. Julie jumps out of her skin STUDENTS letting off FIRECRACKERS as they fly past on bic Will and Julie are now thinking the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cont'd) It was one year ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...the anniversary. That's what's going on...Take it easy on yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weary) I'm trying. I really am...Sometimes I don't even know why I came up here in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheering her up) To get out of Southport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softens) Right. Now I remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at her. She smiles back. They stop in front of building. JULIE (cont'd) Are you getting out of town on the fourth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I'll probably just be here studying for finals. The joys of summer school... (beat) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches his face affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the talk, Will. You're good to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands there akwardly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...Okay. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walks away. Julie watches him a beat, then turns dow

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: steps out of the shadows. Julie practically faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my god, Ray. You scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recovering, she hugs Ray, genuinely glad to see him. He's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got in early. I was excited... (re: the receding Will) Who was that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's Will. He's a friend. You'd like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, we're just friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every guy in history who tried to pick up a girl did the good-friend thing first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you being like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should be obvious Ray feels insecure in the college en they're miscommunicating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm sorry. You're right. Are you ready to go? I've got the old truck. You know the drill...Crab boil at Ollie's. Croaker Queen Pageant...It's only small-town fun, but it's still nice. People really miss you. I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Ray, his compassionate demeanor. This is har

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, but resolved) Ray, I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just feel like some part of me hasn't healed up enough to go back. Like some critical piece is missing. Please understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is cold. This is what he's expected all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like that. It's not you. It's me. My head. I want to go back. I want to be with you. I want to be fine. I want everything to be like it used to be. (beat) It just isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is hurt and confused. JULIE (cont'd) Hey, why don't you stay up here? They have fireworks over the river. And...there's a million things to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to work, Julie. My boat's in Southport, remember? But, I get it. You need your space from Craokerland. And maybe from me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray starts walking away. RAY (cont'd) You know where to find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray? Ray? At least come up for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray keeps on walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'm just gonna go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie follows him out to the road. A group of LAUGHING ST her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, I'm sorry. I didn't mean... (to herself) I'm just scared...that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Ray is already gone. Julie stares after him a beat, t quickly to her door. She clearly feels uncomfortable, exp walk alone. She nervously pulls her keys. A can of mace d the keychain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students throw FRISBEE in the street. Ray walks to his ol which is wedged between a new Sport Utility and a BMW. He clambers into the front seat. He thinks. Then, digs in and pulls out the unmistakable shape of an ENGAGEMENT RIN throws it in the glove box, starts the truck and drives a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie opens the door and steps inside. She locks three de stands there, alone, listening to the SILENCE. She doesn' cat. A faucet DRIPS in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faucet DRIPS. Julie turns the handle. No success. She lock on each window. She stands for a moment. She picks up a bag of chips and eats a handful. She opens and takes out a can of nacho cheese sauce. She grabs a so a jar of bread-and-butter pickles. She gets some cookies She thinks. Opens the freezer, pulls out some fat-free so She takes the whole mess toward her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hits the light switch. A bedside light goes on. It's furnished room. The bed is pilled high with pillows. She windows, then climbs into bed with the food. On the bedside table are pictures of family and friends. one of Helen and Barry. She looks around the room. It's d Outside we hear young people having fun, slamming car doo places. She picks at the food, then puts it on the table. off the bedside light and enjoys the golden late afternoo room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, sound asleep, is curled into fetal position on the There's a CLICK in the front hall. And ANOTHER. Julie's eyes shoot open. She listens. Another SOUND, almo front door being CLOSED. Her arm reaches for the bedside light. She hits the switc POPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Okay. Okay. Face your fears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets off the bed and stands still. JULIE (cont'd) (whisper) There's nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another NOISE down the hall. JULIE (cont'd) (whisper) Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie silently scoots out of her bedroom toward the kitch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets a large KNIFE. She listens. It sounds like somon living room. She steps through the kitchen door. As she moves we see a shadow pass the other way down the toward her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's NO ONE there. JULIE (cont'd) Okay, calm down, imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She relaxes until she sees that her front door is slightl from the hallway slanting through. JULIE (cont'd) I can't take this anymore. I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the knife in front of her, she tiptoes to the hal a soft RUSTLING coning from her bedroom. She gets a flash a drawer and starts down the hallway. JULIE (cont'd) (fatalistic) Let's just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves faster toward her bedroom. she listens outside It sounds like someone's in the closet. She moves into th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a noise in the darkened closet. Julie moves into She turns the flashlight ON and lunges for the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARLA WILSON, 19, all grace and attitude, is on tiptoes r box of shoes. She SCREAMS. Julie SCREAMS. They both SCREAM together. Julie drops the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were out of town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in my closet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug, jumping up and down with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were out of town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in my closet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i just wanted your black pants, but I'm not ready to die for them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie turns on the light in the hallway. Karla has her sh hand and black pants draped over her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was heart attack time, Karla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. When I put these skinny pants on my body...Now, that's heart attack time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla looks down and sees the knife. She picks it up with fingers -- KARLA (cont'd) And we're going to put away the utensils and you're coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie flops down on her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere. I'm fat, ugly, and depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right -- whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I just really hurt Ray's feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keeping it upbeat) Listen to me, Julie. Ray's a great guy, nothing against old Ray, but he's so...Ray. I mean, he lives in Southport. Will's a nice guy, too, and he lives right down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla picks up the flashlight and goes into the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing between Will and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet. Nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She emerges with clothes for Julie. Holds up one outfit. KARLA (cont'd) What we gotta do is keep moving. No time to mope. I'm working at the club tonight. And you, dancing queen, are coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla holds up another dress for Julie -- strapless, sexy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, then be fat, ugly, and depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla is dancing around. Julie laughs at her friend and t dress when Karla hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hopping college joint: crowded, loud MUSIC, a danc rivers of cheap booze.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: Julie sits next to Karla as she waits for her drink order A handsome young man slides in front of them. This is TYR 23, handsome, no pretention, a little dangerous, with a k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I want to do to you ...right now, don't you? There's gotta be somewhere we can be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playful) I don't think so. It's pretty crowded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for a minute, baby. I got something I wanna tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's looking for a dark corner or a storeroom or somethin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) If you can say all you gotta say in a minute then I don't wanna hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk real slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's kissing her ear. She starts to giggle. The bartender sets down drinks on Karla's tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Julie) Ask her to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell hesitates. KARLA (cont'd) Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla cuts away through the crowd, delivering drinks. Tyr Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the most beautiful woman in the bar tonight, Jules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell, you are an unstoppable force of nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. It's how the species survives. You'll never convince me otherwise. (beat) Wanna dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla passes by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No means yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell, I appreciate it, but have you seen my people dance? We make the mouth face, we move the fingers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading for the floor) Worse comes to worse, you can stand there and watch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'll take a break and we'll all dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is packed and thumping. Karla is dancing her way through Tyrell and Julie follow behind her. Karla sees Will. He's dressed up and nervous. She smiles. KARLA (cont'd) Whaddayou know? Will Benson lookin' fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious, but having fun) Karla! Did you tell him I'd be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. I told him that you absolutely, positively would not be here at this bar between ten o'clock and eleven o'clock tonight. And then he came anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shy to a fault) This was not my idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, this...Do you want a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks down at his feet. He and Julie stand there not knowing what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I come from, you want to snatch the goodies, you got to at least talk to them first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell and Karla go for it on the dance floor, leaving Wi alone. They look at each other. They look at everyone dan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is a few steps ahead as they move for the bar. Julie relaxing, having a good time. Then, she looks up into the sees, in a strobe light's FLASH --

dialogues.speaker: SOMEONE IN A SLICKER
dialogues.text: watching her intently. She squints for a better look, but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over the din) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's chalk white and crestfallen. Her whole affect is "W have a normal time?" She drifts amay toward the stairs to WILL (cont'd) Hey Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will catches Karla and Tyrell's eyes. They're worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie catches another glimps of THE SLICKER. She pushes her way through the crowd up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie looks all around -- finally spotting the MAN IN THE behind, making his way to the other side. He slices through a crowd of students, and Julie keeps fo turns down a service corridor. Julie follows, frightened, but unable to resist. She catches him at the end of the corridor. She reaches o the stranger's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stranger turns around. It's only a club kid in a tack raincoat and hat. She's shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hye, baby. You following me up here? (a come-on) Well, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie turns away and hurries down the hallway. Todd follo figure quickly fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With morning sun filtering through her blinds, Julie wake strange sound of THUMPING. She gets out of bed and slowly room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise gets louder as she heads down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: A CLOSET
dialogues.text: The noise is at its loudest -- Julie reaches for a doorkn yanks open the door.

dialogues.speaker: A CLOTHES DRYER
dialogues.text: rocking and banging inside the closet. Julie frowns. Julie spins, once again startled by Karla, who crosses to flipping open the lid and then jumping back to catch the pop out on the fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still sleepy) That could break the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, people who end up making rules like that end up beating their kids with wire hangers. It's a fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS. Karla looks at her watch. KARLA (cont'd) It's Tyrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned) The number's unlisted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you relax? We've been dating three months. He ain't stalking your butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it, and it feels good. (answering the phone) Hi, Ty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DJ for a local radio station BOOMS from the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mark in the Morning for Magic 96.7 Radio Station! Who am I speaking with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie watches her friend get excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark in the Morning! Magic 96.7! Oh my God! I'm Karla. Karla Wilson. (to Julie) Jules, it's Mark in the Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Karla, what're you doin' at home over the long fourth weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm in school and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you like to win a Magic 96.7 Quicky Getaway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie hits the SPEAKERPHONE BUTTON and Karla hangs up. Th echos through the appartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, then I hope you remember your geography, Karla, because all you have to do to win is tell me the capital of Brazil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla's smile abruptly fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Brazil? Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to Julie, whose face is as blank as hers. KARLA (cont'd) You don't know?! You have to know. You know everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Karla, one easy question, one great getaway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) ...South America...Carnival...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla, we need an answer. No looking it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still here...thinking... (stalling) You mean Brazil, the country?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Karla, five seconds. (counting down) Five...Four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie has an idea. She scramles for the kitchen. Grabs a GROUND COFFEE from the FREEZER. MARK (cont'd, V.O.) Three...Two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie tosses the bag across the room to Karla. Karla read RIO BLEND -- 100% BRAZILIAN COFFEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting) Rio de Janeiro!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no...Did you say Rio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing) No. Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLS and WHISTLES and triumphant MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just won Magic 96.7's Quickie Getaway...a trip for four to Tower Bay Island in the fabulous Bahamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla and Julie jump up and down ecstatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waaaaahhhhhhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll call you back with all the details...So what's your favorite radio station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic 96.7!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie hangs up and joins Karla dancing on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won. I won...I won, I won, I won. (teasing) Now, let's see...There's Tyrell, that's one. And, there's my parents ...And I got some cousins. (beat) Okay, Julie, you can come, but Mark said four tickets. That means you gotta get yourself a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie thinks, she seems torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL MOUND OF RED SNAPPER is DUMPED -- wiggling and su way across the deck of a fishing boat. WE PULL AWAY TO REVEAL it's RAY who's just done the dumpi coworker, DAVE, friendly, playful, and down-to-earth, cal the dock --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ray...phone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray takes the phone. WE INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is happy to hear her voice, but cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Hey. I'm really glad you called... I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (compassoinate) No, you don't have to be sorry. I'm the one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I shouldn't have left so fast... I was just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave holds up two wriggling snappers. He dances them towa in a puppetlike mating ritual, making KISSING SOUNDS and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the fish) Julie, I love you. I know I'm only a humble fish, but if you really look at it, you're a fish, too. (girl voice) Oh, Ray, you're right...Do me like a snapper. (mashing the fish together) Hey, something smells like fish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray waves him away, concentrating on his call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, Karla won a trip to the Bahamas! An island called Tower Bay. And she wants us to come with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? The Bahamas? You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's interest is piqued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd have a long weekend just to sit in the sun, drink fruity drinks, and swim, and... (sexy) You know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave is watching Ray closely. Ray's expression hardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) You'll go away with you're college friends, but you won't go away with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiot. Idiot. Idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla is watching Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not you, it's Southport. And it's the Bahamas! And it's free!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla is watching Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta sell his butt on the Bahamas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, come on. I want us to be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray thinks. Dave looks at him like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't give in) Julie, we're working a big run up here. It's been crazy. We probably have to go out again tonight. I don't think I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you try...for me, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave moves one of the fish like it's been shot through th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll try. But, listen... (martyrlike) If I don't make it up, then you go ahead and have a great time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray...please try. I really miss you. (beat) Okay. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and Karla sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That boy has got fish on the brain. (sensitive) Hey, cheer up, Charlie. (singing a rumba) We're going to the Bahamas. Bahama Mama, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is staring unhappily at the little pile of snapper. D staring at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, what is your problem? We haven't caught anything for days. Pull the big ugly stick out of your butt. She asked you to go to the Bahamas! Man, you gotta go. We'll both drive up. I got friends I can see up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray realizes how right he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid. Stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid. What were you thinkng?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks at Dave a contemplative beat, then walks over t He leans in the passenger side and pulls out the engageme Dave walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna see what I've been thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the box and slowly opens it. Dave is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Ray, fourth and forty, throw the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go up there. I should call her back, tell her I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man. Surprise her. She'll be psyched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is excited by the plan and Dave's right there with hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stare out at a rain-soaked stretch of road. A PICKUP ROARS past, cruising along with its RADIO loud a rolled down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music's even LOUDER in here. The mood is high...Two b to propose to a girl. Dave adjusts the radio to another A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I love AM radio. You got right-wing conspiracy, tips for pregnant womem, Single-A baseball games, and real country music... None of that new crap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He adjusts the dial again, tuning in a country song, "MAM YOUR BABIES GROW UP TO BE COWBOYS," by Waylon Jennings an Nelson. Dave starts singing along, extra LOUD and out of tune. DAVE (cont'd) (singing) "...Mamas, don't let your babies grow up to be cowboys, don't let 'em pick guitars and drive them old trucks. Let 'em be doctors and lawyers and such."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks at his goofy friend singing and starts to get a himself... Then, Ray sees something in the road ahead. He turns down They both stare --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: its HAZARDS blinking. Ray slows and creeps past the car. The driver's door is o appears EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: A BODY
dialogues.text: is sprawled out in the road away from the car. Ray pulls shoulder and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) I don't know, man. Maybe we should keep going, find a phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy looks dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray has seen this before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws open his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray steps from his truck. Looks back at the empty car, th toward the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Hey! Buddy, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND RAY
dialogues.text: and behind Dave, in the other car, a FIGURE IN A SLICKER the back seat and gets out of the car. Ray continues toward the body.

dialogues.speaker: FACE DOWN
dialogues.text: Ray moves closer to the all to familiar image.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND RAY
dialogues.text: SLICKER FIGURE moves toward the unsuspecting Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave watches Ray in the road. He leans across the seat an Ray's window. Behind him, the SLICKER FIGURE gets closer, moving to the side of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray nears the body. He kneels down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray reaches toward the body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something FLASHES IN THE SIDE-VIEW MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray turns over the body. Something isn't right. Ray jumps

dialogues.speaker: SLICKER MANNEQUIN
dialogues.text: Its eerie smile mocking Ray who turns for the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave hears something. He turns to late. SPLLAATTT!!! THE jams his hook through Dave's jaw and skull and YANKS DAVE CAR WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Dave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no answer from dead Dave. Ray tries to see around headlights. He moves slowly toward the truck. The BRIGHTS and FOGS come on, blinding Ray. The truck's e The truck rolls a few inches, adjusting a bead on Ray. Then, tires spinning, the truck launches straight at Ray. Ray runs at the truck. AT THE LAST MINUTE, he ducks behin car. HIS TRUCK goes SCREAMING past. Ray backs around the car --

dialogues.speaker: AN EIGHTEEN-WHEELER
dialogues.text: goes barreling by in the other direction. Ray dives out o

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ROAD
dialogues.text: Ray is exposed. He sees his truck closing fast. He's got go. Then, at the very last second,

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: jumps off the edge of the road. His TRUCK SLAMS INTO THE

dialogues.speaker: WHERE RAY WAS STANDING. SPARKS FLY
dialogues.text: Ray falls through the air. Lands hard on his leg. Tumbles hill, finally stopping with a crash. He lies motionless a of a ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla exits the building. She watches Julie sitting on th A truck turns onto the street. Julie looks hopeful, but - Ray. Karla approaches her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, it's gettin' down to the wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not coming. I thought he was just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, you left four messages... Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, he said he'd try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he'd try. Try is like maybe. Try is nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appoligizing for him) He does work hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work hard, huh? He's breaking your heart just because he can. (hesitant) And I don't want to have to say I told you so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jeep Cherokee stops, and an ebullient Tyrell steps out shorts and a Hawaiian shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, baby, we gonna get tropical or we gonna get tropical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passenger door opens and Will Benson steps hesitantly Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Will) Hey, sorry... (quick, playing it off) He's my friend, too. And that ticket is not going to waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will reads Julie's expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, is everything cool? Karla said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said we start having fun. And that means now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie takes a last look up the street. She stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where there's a Will, there's a way. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deciding) You know what? This rocks. We're going to the Bahamas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting into the spirit) We goin' Bahamas, I'm Ty's Bahama Mama. We goin' Bahamas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bops over to Tyrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide-body jet SCREAMS through the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nearly empty jet. Karla has her head on Tyrell's should reading a book. Will's knuckles are white from gripping the armrests in f eyes are clenched shut. Julie looks on with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take deep breaths and think of something happy from childhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I don't have anything happy from childhood...Sorry, I can't relax going five hundred miles an hour, or four thousand, four hundred feet a minute... (calculating) Which is over seven hundred feet a second. Imagine hitting something at seven hundred feet a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep breaths --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no deep breaths) Fumes build up in the fuel tanks. You can by surface-to-air missiles over the internet. Planes use O-rings...which freeze in tap water. Planes fall from the sky for practically no reason at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a better chance of getting hit by lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Planes get hit by lightning. They get hit by meteors. They hit other planes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Something is gonna hit your butt if you don't quit complaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sypathetic) Honey, some folks just can't fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will doesn't move, frozen with fear of flying, but more c with the concerned Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. A Board of Tourism kind of shot. Blue water islands. Golden sun. Puffy clouds. A BOAT CHUGS by with the words "Tower Bay" painted on the Tyrell THROWS UP over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More of a small tub than a ferry. Julie, Karla, Will, and the only passengers. At the bow, Julie and Karla laugh and play "King of the W in the prow, Karla behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) I'm the King of the World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) No, I'm the King of the World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They switch places. They look at each other and crack up Karla takes in the surroundings, the salt spray, the day

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me to study real hard so someday this is normal and all that back there is somethin' I do for a weekend once every ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharing the moment) I will, and you remind me of the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They throws their arms around each other and stare into t

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STERN
dialogues.text: Will talks to a very green Tyrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just gotta breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell is trying to keep from puking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't talk right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly malicious) See, it's not a macho thing. It's about equilibrium in your inner ear. You could've used a patch, but it's too late now. Get used to it. (then) Some folks just can't sail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAULSEN, the BOAT CAPTAIN, overhears as he passes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad, too, because it's the only way on or off the island. (slightly ominous) Unless you have an accident. And then they call the Coast Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Karla have rejoined the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty remote here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yep. That's what the tourists pay for -- sun, sea, and solitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we there yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move off the boat and REVEAL the island. The intrepid excitedly take in the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. An isolated tropical paradise with jungle g beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferry pulls in to a canopied dock. A white-sand beach every direction. Beautiful tourists stroll about without world. Tyrell stamps his feet on the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I'm still on that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dockhand, DERRICK, glides past him toward the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way for a complimentary Planter's Punch to get you readjusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mile-wide smile) I can get used to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derrick reaches for Julie's hand, clearly checking her ou process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, Fair Princess, to Tower Bay. (a wink) I'm Derrick. At your service for the duration of your stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie smiles politely. Will gently nudges her on. They wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Derrick, mocking) I'm at your service, Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Season's over old man. So I gotta work fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Marine Radio's right about the weather, you're already out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs a SIGN at the end of the gangplank. It reads: LA FERRY -- LINE FORMS HERE. Our guys are already at the end of the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. An opulent, Carribean-style hacienda resort accoutrements. The main building is two stories high with a tiled roof. rises from one side. And, of course, it is surounded on a suffocating fooliage. Julie and Karla take in the beauty of the resort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: TOW BIKINI GIRLS
dialogues.text: catch the eyes of Tyrell and Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla THWACKS him on the back of the head, but they're al The path widens. The trees part. It's even nicer up close across a tiled plaza. Behind them, THREE YOUNG GUYS carry their GIRLFRIENDS pig racing each other toward the departure dock. Our two arriving couples move on toward the entrace, pass TENNIS COURT on the left. A GLASS-PANED ORCHID HOUSE stra And, on the right, A LUSH POOL with a built-in JACUZZI in the shallow end. A THATCHED ROOF BAR stands nearby -- and just beyonk it, a HOUSE. A guy's unintelligible RASTA VOICE calls out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybudorsomethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see TITUS, white guy, dreads, full-Rasta dem phony, but sincere about it. Titus approaches Tyrell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother, can I interest you in the islands finest ganja?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) Hey, Tyrell, we found you brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry) Not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (undetered) Who be wantin' the kind, the uber- sticky, the Bwana, The depth-charge, the Up-All-Night-Laughing-With-Your- Friends? Who wants it? 'Cause Titus got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man. Everybody wants something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Tyrell walk on. Undetered, Titus goes up to Karl TITUS (cont'd) How 'bout you, ladies? Lovely ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Titus moves his hips. TITUS (cont'd) (lascivious) Something I can do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla looks him up and down, wrinkles her nose --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a bath, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cold, but if that's how you want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group moves on. Titus watches them go -- TITUS (cont'd) (yelling after them) Anybudorsomethin' you come and see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OMIT SCENE 21 & SCENE 22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around TWENTY TO THIRTY GUESTS ARE ON THEIR WAY OUT as Ju others walk in. Julie smiles at an old PORTER helping the guests with their bags. He doesn't smile back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel is tastefully appointed with island decor. AN O STAIRCASE leads UP to the ROOMS -- and DOWN (AS THE SIGN FITNESS CENTER. In one direction, the foyer meets the entrance to a tropi RESTAURANT/BAR. And in the other, A LOOBY LOUNGE is visib surrounded by four walls of BOOKS and HOTEL MEMORABILIA. In a dark corner of the room, a uniformed MAID named OLGA massive WOODEN GLOBE. Julie smiles at the woman on their way through the lobby, shyly looks away. Arriving at the FRONT DESK, the four of them find it dese wait patiently, then impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: A DESK BELL
dialogues.text: as Karla slaps it with her palm. The bell RINGS for a lon fades into SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everyone? I'll ask --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie turns to consult the maid.

dialogues.speaker: THE GLOBE
dialogues.text: The big ball is spinning. But Olga is no longer in sight. Tyrell heads toward a DOOR beside the counter with a sign PRIVATE OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll scare somebody up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the knob and pulls the door open to...

dialogues.speaker: RROWWWR
dialogues.text: maw snapping shut about a half inch from his nose. TYRELL (cont'd) Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Karla laugh. Karla goes to hit the bell once mo HAVE HER HAND GRABBED IN THE PROCESS. Karla gasps. Pulls away. We see the hand belongs to the h -- BROOKS, balding, 40s, talks slowly, and seems to have won't share with guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking in...Karla Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will saunters away to look at the books in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (condescending) Ah, yes. Roll out the red carpet. Our contest winners are here at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scans a sheet as Tyrell stares at the pit bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I've found peices of guys like you in his stool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell is put off by this aggressive comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocent) I don't have a problem in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering) It sure is a beautiful old hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud) Built in 1948 for a member of the Rockefeller clan. The tile work was imported from Spain. A lot of history in these walls...Judy Garland stayed here...Hemmingway fished for marlin right off that dock --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we get it...It's old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll outlive you, I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creepy thing to say. Slides a registration form. BROOKS (cont'd) Wilson comma Karla... (sees something on the form) Oh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooks covers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in 201 and 202.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (expecting this) Is that bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying) Not at all. Those are our honeymoon suites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell wraps his arms around Karla. Julie looks uncomfort Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honeymoon suites. I take it you kids haven't exchanged vows, yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't exchanged anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, we're talkin' suites! (excited) That'll be just fine with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, while you're here, our marginally trained, off-season staff of five will attend to your every need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...Did you say off-season?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: July fourth weekend. Storm season starts today. The clouds roll in like clockwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm season?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our version of winter. (hands over the keys) 201 and 202. There's Scrabble and Parcheesi in the lobby. Enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Brooks turns away through the office door. They walk rooms. Will catches up with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the hallway. Karla seems annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't nothin' free in this world. Everybody says it, and it's true. (dissapointed) I wanted you all to have a good trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will, baby...All this means is we got the whole island to ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's been blue skies all day. It might be perfect all weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It beets being on the mainland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, the mainland --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's gone tropical on us, baby. Tropical!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mood is improving. A SQUEEKING NOISE interupts. A BRASS LUGGAGE CART has appeared behind them. And ESTES, weary Haitian porter, steps from behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a Carribean accent) 201 and 202...Who put you in...? (hesitant) Don't use these much --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees their happy, expectant faces and changes the subj

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No real reason. (then) Pretty fancy rooms for kids your age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won a competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? What you have to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess the capital of Brazil --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rio, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, good for you, girl. (waiting for a cue) ...And, where would you like me to put the bags?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as Julie and Karla exchange a look. Then, Karla to the keys to Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Estes) Their stuff in there... (grabbing Tyrell) ...and ours in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla! You promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Tyrell) I also promised Tyrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promised me what, baby? (joking around) I made all my promises to William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell makes fake goo-goo eyes at Will. Estes looks away. TYRELL (cont'd) Sweetie, you brought your nightie, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forward! A girl needs time to make up his mind. (to Julie, thoughtful) Julie, look, if it's cool, I'll sleep on the couch and they can have their own room to practice for that real honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tyrell grabs Karla and drags her into the room. We he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've been doing this since before you were a dream in your father's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estes grabs the bags and takes them into the room. Julie left staring at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure it's okay with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noting his sweetness) Sure. It's fine. As long as you don't snore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can toss a shoe at me if it gets out of hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs and they go into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP. BEEP. BEEP. Ray is hooked up to a heart monitor. Al asleep, we can tell he's bruised and generally beaten up. WE RACK to a DOCTOR checking on him through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a COP next to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's beaten up pretty bad --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but he seemed certain his friend was killed out on the highway by somebody named Ben Willis. (hisitant) He said he has a hook on his hand. He said he was driving a BMW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cop stares at him deadpan, the doctor realizes how this must sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP: Ray's eyes pop open. He's listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop explains things to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no body. And there was no other vehical involved. (beat) He fell asleep at the wheel...and ran his old truck into a guardrail. He got thrown way the hell down into a ditch. He's damn lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk back down the ICU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) He suffered a severe head trauma --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably once he rests up, it'll all come back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor and cop approach the nurse's station. The NURS a magazine. She folds it away. Suddenly, the monitoring equpment goes OFF with a series WARNINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already moving) That's your number twelve --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor, nurse, and country cop hurry back toward Ray' NURSE (cont'd) (yelling) Get me some help down here. We got a flatline, room twelve.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGHT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: The wires and monitors are unhooked and Ray is GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A resort bar on the beach. Ocean breezes and surf SOUNDS the window. It's tiki galore, complete with a bamboo bar and fishing from decorative nets from the ceiling. There's a KARAOKE corner. Will and Tyrell enter and head straight to the bar. A bor tender, NANCY, looks just like Jennifer Esposito, doesn't her paperback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the emptiness) Tell me this ain't the bar scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't get all dressed up for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planter's Punch, Singapore Sling, or how about a Mai-Tai?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about some ID?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They freeze. NANCY (cont'd) Kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy at the desk said the place would be quiet, not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't anyone tell you this is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last day of the season. Yeah, we heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are you still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell sizes her up quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, boy trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leave you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Tyrell exchange a danger-Will-Robinson glance. NANCY (cont'd) What you want is a Dark and Stormy: Vernon's rum, ginger beer, and a touch of Tabasco. Sailors drink it for luck in the hurricane season, trust me.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE BAR
dialogues.text: Karla and Julie walk in talking quietly to one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I bad? I mean, he's really great, and he's cute --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cute...And he's got a crush on you... (off Julie's look) But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appologetic) I miss Ray...I tried to call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla looks at her. She's sincere, but firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray made up his own mind...so, you're free to make up yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joining the men, but continuing her thought -- KARLA (cont'd) For the next foury-eight hours... (joking) Your smile is a frown...turned upside down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She illustrates with her own big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty cool bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all start to look the same once you've worked in one. (to Nancy) Am I right, sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy reaches out a hand and they touch just the tips of fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nancy) I'm Julie. This is Karla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy. (sarcastic) Welcome to Tower Bay's most happenin' hotspot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy continues making their cocktails.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: backs into something, turns and gasps -- it's a statue of WHALER, complete with HARPOON, WHITE BEARD, and YELLOW SL She doesn't let Karla see that it upset her. Nancy puts their drinks down in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four Dark and Stormies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all pick up their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (toasting) To a great weekend --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a great weekend. Forget the weather! KARLA & JULIE I'll drink to that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drink and toast again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nancy) So what do you do around here for fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy looks straight at Will --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make fun of tourists mainly. (beat) Or let them make fun of themselves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flips a switch that lights the Karaoke stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karaoke -- perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's already heading for the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go baby! Go!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STAGE
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the karaoke machine. Karla flips through a binde songs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this ain't for me, baby, this is for somebody who really needs it. (finds one) Ah-hah! One single with extra cheese!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it's true) Everyone thinks their a singer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me...no way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, it'll be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, please put your hands together for my friend, my very best friend, Julie James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there will be no mercy. KARLA, TYRELL, & WILL (chanting in unison) Ju-lie! Ju-lie! Ju-lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly she goes to the song book. She sees something particularily awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked for it. (to Tyrell) Song number thirty-nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell nods and punches a few buttons. Julie takes the st strings begin to swell. She looks at the MONITOR, then melodramatically at the crowd, and begins to sing -- no, Gloria Gaynor's "I WILL SURVIVE." JULIE (cont'd) (singing) First I was afraid...I was petrified... (continues singing under)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands, clapping. Tyrell pounds his chest. Karla fli LIGHTER, swaying like a hard-core fan. And Julie continue out the chorus as the beat kicks in and the gang begins t JULIE (cont'd) (singing) I will survive...I will survive...

dialogues.speaker: THE KARAOKE MONITOR
dialogues.text: The schmaltzy lyrics keep scrolling by -- white against b then...in the middle of the song...the color changes. RED LETTERS BEGIN TO FILL THE SCREEN. JULIE (cont'd) (singing -- then trailing off) And I still know...what you did... last summer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice trails. Her smile abruptly fades.

dialogues.speaker: MICROPHONE
dialogues.text: falls to the floor. The room echoes with an electronic WH stops dancing, confused.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: trembling, shaking, a mess. Will jumps onstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did something to the screen...it, it, said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie loos at the screen -- the normal lyrics are still s suddenly feels their eyes upon her. They're looking at he having a nervous breakdown. JULIE (cont'd) Nothing. Nothing, I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stung, she rushes off the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's to late. She's bolted from the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie steps into her room. Closes the door behind her. Sh against it, trying to calm herself down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way...just stop it right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around the cozy room. JULIE (cont'd) Closet. Bed. Bathroom. No need to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie starts to undress, get ready for bed, the day of tr catching up with her. She grabs something to sleep in. To the bed. And that's when she sees it,

dialogues.speaker: ENVELOPE
dialogues.text: propped on the pillows. Her name written across. She is f momentarily. Almost against her will, she moves toward the envelope. S down and picks it up. She hesitates, then opens the envelope. She pulls out a S CARD.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARD
dialogues.text: In bold print it reads: SURPRISE!

dialogues.speaker: DARKFIGURE
dialogues.text: appears over Julie's shoulder. Julie can feel the presenc scaring --

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: who YELLS and drops the flowers and champagne he was hold bottle bursts and covers them with spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) Oh, Will! I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fault. I shouldn't have...I didn't think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a TOWEL off the bathroom door, trying to help h the mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. This was really sweet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I scared you -- I crossed the line --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- it's not that. It's...I'm just a little on edge. I'm really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you don't have to appologize to me. I'm the one. I understand. (covering the awkwardness) I'm going to take a walk and dry off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? I really appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a rose. Most of its petals on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just really like you and I want you to feel good about everything...You know? I want you to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the rose to her. There's a moment between them. reluctantly heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks down at his wet pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soto) Dork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing Karla and Tyrell's room on his way down the hall, the DO NOT DISTURB SIGN. He hears an INCREDIBLE POUNDING from inside. He shakes hi mopes down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla bounces playfully on their big bed as Tyrell crosse windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tha's it. (bounce) I've decided. (bounce) I'm changing my major to finance. (bounce) And going to Wall Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause that's the only way I'm ever gonna be able to afford a big bed like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She falls back against the plush comforter, looking up at long MIRROR HANGING RIGHT OVER THE BED. Tyrell loves this moves beside her in the bed. She lets him get real close, jumps up -- KARLA (cont'd) Jacuzzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell reaches for her, but she bounces off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, baby, let's stay right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla pulls her suit out of a bag and models it seductive flirtatiously for Tyrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent a hundred bucks on it...even if it's just so you can pull it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell gets off the bed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the sound of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derrick, the dockhand, whistles in the darkness as he coi rope of a service boat around a cleat on the dock. Ominous shadows play all along the dock. Out on the water big SPLASH. The dockhand rises, looking out at the water with a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. I should've brought my pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away. As he does, we see

dialogues.speaker: THE END OF THE DOCK
dialogues.text: where a sinister SLICKER FIGURE stands perfectly still, s moonlight. Derrick paces down the dock the other way past a handfull tied-off staff and service boats. He picks up a hose and begins spraying down the hull of a sailboat. He turns the hose off and begins coiling it, backing towa EQUIPMENT SHACK. Suddenly, a HAND touches him on the back and turns to see --

dialogues.speaker: TITUS
dialogues.text: standing there smoking a spliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost, you scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish are all over the water...Come on, let us take a boat out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Titus, you're so stoned, you'd end up in Spain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you'll come with Titus, mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derrick throws the hose in its place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a storm comin', Titus. No boats are going out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm is what makes it interesting. Thass why all the fish are up. Less hook us a couple big ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derrick is now ignoring Titus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got work to do. Take the bake elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up-tighteous and self-righteous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Titus glides away into the dark. Derrick watches him go. another SPLASH in the water near the dock. Derrick walks to where the splash was. He kneels down by watching BUBBLES RISE from the dark water below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the fish) Hello, little sea bass. You're lucky I'm busy or I'd hook you myself.

dialogues.speaker: DOCKHAND
dialogues.text: Derrick hears A SPLASH -- and just in time for...

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: as poor Derrick's BLOOD MIXES WITH BUBBLES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubbles of a different kind. The JACUZZI sits in an enclo shallow end of the SWIMMING POOL. And enjoying its warmth, Karla and Tyrell are liplocked i churning tub. MUSIC plays on the boombox beside them. The tempurature rises and Ty's hands begin to wander. Sti her cute bikini, Karla pulls away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you didn't pick up my hair tie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubbing his bald head) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I just didn't wanna get my hair wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, I finally got you alone in this Jacuzzi and I don't wanna be discussin' hair care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She splashes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get feisty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell moves in for the kill. He won't take no for an ans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late for that. We're miles from anywhere, baby. No one's gonna hear you scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes in for a serious kiss. Things start to heat up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be a lifeguard...I'd hate to have to blow my whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playful) I'd hate for you to have to blow...your whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell is done talking. He pulls her over to him and the becomes more passionate. Karla opens her eyes in time to see --

dialogues.speaker: TITUS
dialogues.text: surface in the pool next to them. Karla SCREAMS. And not just because it was a surprise. Ti even uglier when he's wet. Titus opens his mouth, reveals a smoking PHILLY BLUNT on his tounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No water sports after midnight. Hotel policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Titus eyes Karla in the Jacuzzi. Tyrell moves protectivel her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the policy on burnin' herb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got one for that, too. It's don't try until you buy. (beat) You don't buy any, you don't get any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Titus blows a cloud of smoke on them both, rolls the join his mouth, and swims off. Tyrell is angry, but Karla pull A dejected Will appears in his bathing suit, a towel over Tyrell sees him coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's ten people on this whole island and they're all gonna end up in this Jacuzzi with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting in) How's the water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will slips into the water ignoring Tyrell's look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, that feels great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considerate) How's Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone. In the room. (to Karla) Got any advise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Yeah. Find another Jacuzzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla shoots Tyrell a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Will) Your not out yet, slugger. You gotta just get back up there and keep swingin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is at a telephone booth up the street from Julie's ap He looks exausted. Blood seeps through his shirt. He's in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need an international operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the empty night lobby, behind the desk

dialogues.speaker: THE TELEPHONE
dialogues.text: RINGS and RINGS. We push in on the phone RINGING unanswer night. Nobody is around to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR CREAKS OPEN once again to her room. And from a S -- WE SLOWLY CREEP INSIDE. A CLOUD OF STEAM billows from the open BATHROOM. THE SOUN is heard. We MOVE TOWARD IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes closed, Julie stands with her face right under the s trying to relax. Something softly goes THUMP. Julie opens her eyes. Turns off the shower. Stands there, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Will...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BATHROOM DOORWAY
dialogues.text: In a robe with a towel on her head, Julie peeks into her there. She sighs, and crosses back to the bathroom sink.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SINK
dialogues.text: Julie looks to a spot where her toothbrush should be. She Looks around. Some of her things are missing. She peers i fogged-up bathroom mirror. She whips the TOWEL off her head and WIPES IT ACROSS THE MAKING THE BEDROOM BEHIND HER VISIBLE. Ready to spit, she looks down. AND IN THAT INSTANT -- WE FIGURE PASS BEHIND HER IN THE BEDROOM. She looks back up. GONE. Julie turns on the water to rinse.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: as it SLOWLY CREAKS SHUT, the SOUND DROWNED OUT by the SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie turns off the water -- and KLUNK-KLUNK -- and NOISE The sound STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps out of the bathroom, crossing toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. She peers through the PEEPHOLE. JULIE (cont'd) Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unlocks and opens it. Nobody there. Julie quickly closes the door and relocks it, her heart r begining to rise again as... KLUNK-KLUNK. She hears it again. Then, the sound STOPS. B at the door -- she realizes that's not where it came from immediately go to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. That's where it came from. She slowy pads across th slippers toward the door. Trembling...she reaches for the

dialogues.speaker: TUGS IT OPEN
dialogues.text: There's NOTHING. She stares a beat. DRIP DRIP DRIP. She sees something on the floor of the closet. She touche it. IT'S BLOOD. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCKHAND
dialogues.text: comes dropping down at her, dangling, enmeshed in barbed dying before our eyes. Blood bubbling from his mouth. His twitching. Julie stares at the body. She's almost catatonic. She bli blinks again. Suddenly, in DEATH CONVULSIONS, his arms fly toward her - She SCREAMS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla and Tyrell are drying off beside Will as their hyst comes racing across the pool plaza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's happening again! There's a body!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will cathes her in his arms and she sobs uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What are you talking about? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in my room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can see she's not fooling around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is gathered in the center of Julie's room. Julie tight by Will. Brooks, the hotel manager, conducts the in Brooks approaches the closet door. Julie holds her breath it open. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't find this at all funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie steps in -- stares into the empty closet. She can't eyes. She searches their faces, looking for someone to believe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a body! I swear it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delicately) Julie, you said you were tired. Waybe you were dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharp) I wasn't dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you people were goining to be trouble. I knew from the first time I laid eyes on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie grabs Brooks by his robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. He's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Who is here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know where to start. Nancy pokes her head aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie thinks there's a dead guy in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of us see bathrobes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharp) I am not crazy, Tyrell. He was right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not taking it seriously) Fine. Show me the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will wanders over to the closet and checks it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about this, Julie. What did you actually see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dockhand guy. Hanging by his neck from up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (case closed) In the morning we'll talk to Derrick, the "dockhand guy," and put the whole thing to rest. (looks to Nancy) Now, let's slow down on the Dark and Stormies and get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want off this island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tired) Not possible, I'm afraid. The last ferry left hours ago. And we got a storm coming. There won't be another one for days.
