dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a storm coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Tis the season, like I told you. It's a big one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie goes for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll call the mainland for a charter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phones went down a few minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the phone, listens, then dangles it from her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exasperated Brooks heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh. The next couple of days is gonna be rough, but we'll make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Emergencies only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell would you call this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd call this four spoiled city kids who wouldn't know a hurricane if it blew up their butts. (beat) All we can do now is batten down and ride it out. If things get really bad, there's a storm shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Brooks is gone. Outside the window, it starts to rain CLAP of thunder.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: looks out the window with glazed-over eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we PULL AWAY from Julie's face through the glass -- S above her room to another

dialogues.speaker: TINY WINDOW
dialogues.text: in the bell tower. A candle burns, and lighning flashes i haggard face of Estes, the porter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a claustrophobic room. Estes turns away from the win shirtless in his uniform pants. A beaded cord hangs aroun small fishhook dangling from it. Beside the candle, he picks up a leather bag and dumps ou of voodoo icons: roots, coins, sea glass, chicken's foot. on a divination tray. He opens vials and sprinkles powder and assorted liquids wooden bowl. He opens a drawer and extracts a toothbrush. brush in the bowl -- covering its bristles with a sticky the brush over the candle's flame. The old man watches it ESTES picks up

dialogues.speaker: A STRAW FIGURE
dialogues.text: and impales it on his fishhook necklace. His eyes roll back in his head. He enters a trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olga, the maid, pushes her laundry cart toward the end of dimly lit hall. She sees a pile of dirty linens outside o ROOM 228. She stops, perplexed. There's nobody staying in this room them up and stuff them in her cart. Then she knocks on th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Housekeeping. (beat) Housekeeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knocks again and notices her hand leaving bloody mark door. She looks at her other hand. Her arms and hands are blood. She turns back to the linens. Something bloody is wrapped them. She paws at the sheets, trying to unravel the myste The door the Room 228 slowly cracks open. A STEEL HOOK re slices into her apron. It tugs. She turns, and she starts she is yanked into the room. A DO NOT DISTURB sign flips over the handle and the door We hear her SCREAMS from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. Bars on the windows. Neon PAWN fickering. H sign reads: Se Habla Ingles.

dialogues.speaker: AN ENGAGEMENT RING
dialogues.text: Ray's engagement ring. The pawn shop owner, MAC, cowboy h job, holds it up to the viewing loop next to his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, that's a full carat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's some flaws in her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac looks around his shop at the usual jumble of crap: va cleaners, golf clubs, guitar amps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't really have the market for something like this... (like it hurts him) I can go two...two-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it three hundred. And throw that in, too.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: encased in a glass cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, that's worth three, easy. And you got your waiting period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not waiting...So give me the gun and keep the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac barely hasitates, he knows he's getting a steal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUN AND THE RING
dialogues.text: go down on the counter next to each other. Mac pulls out MAC (cont'd) Fill these out. Leave the dates blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray starts writing. Mac is overcome by a moment of humani MAC (cont'd) Buddy, are you sure this is the way you want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray gives him a steely stare --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it loaded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac shakes his head. RAY (cont'd) Load it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Mac's sadness at young people today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move into the hotel room and gradually reveal FOUR SET the end of one bed. They are crammed into a king-size bed Julie is awake. She gets out of bed and moves toward the It's raining outside. The wind is blowing. The storm has Karla pulls a sleeping hand off her chest. The hand belon She pinches the hand. Will starts. Tyrell kicks his feet around, trying to get some room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't the romantic weekend I had in mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla kisses Tyrell on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julie) You get any sleep at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell glares at Julie by the window. Sees the incredible

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look. Another day in paradise with Julie-your-tour-director...Miss Psychotic Episode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to Julie) See any dead bodies out there? Any fresh kill? How 'bout Freddy, Jason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie ignores him, staring out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry at her boyfriend, Karla gets out of bed and joins J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying what all of you are thinking. It's bad enough gettin' rained out without having to hold her hand the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla pulls Julie close in a show of support for her frie everyone believes has been inventing dead bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay...He doesn't believe me. That's his right. I'm starting to think I'm crazy, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, slow down, turn off the little motor up in there...What do you say we go to the gym and work off a little stress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie doesn't look to enthusiastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla and Julie enter the gym. It has Nautilus machines, Life-cycles, free weights, tanning beds, speed and heavy Karla walks over and does a full roundhouse -- spinning a her foot dead center of the heavy bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be givin' your fisherman some of that and see how he likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie smiles at her friend bravado. She steps over to a s and starts her workout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Tyrell step out of the room into the long, empty They cross to a balcony overlooking the lobby. The whole deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gallows humor) They're all dead...Dead, I tell you. (ghostly) Ahhhh, we're all deaaaddddd. Tyrellll, joinnnn usss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's voice echoes across the lobby. Tyrell is maybe a l nervous, but hiding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the steps to the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cross the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hello? (worried) There's nobody here, Tyrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell's already out the front entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Tyrell exit the hotel and make their way down th outside and go splashing across the flooded grounds. Debr storm is scattered all around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're around...They just don't care about us 'cause we're the contest winners. (beat) Let's go find Stoner Boy...Make his lazy butt hook us up with fishing poles or Ping-Pong paddles or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) You know, the greenhouse effect has caused the gulf stream to shift and almost every meteorological expert expects a dramatic increase in tropical depression --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- shut up, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell keeps walking. Will looks around at the wind-and-w vista. Not much of a day for activities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) I don't like to fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell moves across the grounds. He looks back. Will is s tracks, looking up at --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WINDOW OF THE BELL TOWER --
dialogues.text: ESTES, staring down at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to Will) You coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will trots after him, but he takes a glance back at the w is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie has finished on the stairmaster. Both she and Karla after a good workout. Their moods have improved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Vampira. I got just the thing for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla leads Julie over to the tanning beds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancer in a box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is the safe sun. (joking) It's better than a day at the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie is reluctant. KARLA (cont'd) Come on, a little photosynthesis and you'll feel like a new --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houseplant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla opens the canopy of the tanning bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie peels off her sweats. Lies down in her underwear. S small pair of GOGGLES. Karla lowers the canopy over Julie.

dialogues.speaker: A WALL TIMER
dialogues.text: Karla sets the DIAL. KARLA (cont'd) Set to three seventy-five, bake for one hour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: ULTRA-VIOLET TUBES
dialogues.text: come to life -- Julie is bathed in purple light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell looks across the grounds and sees, at the far end court,

dialogues.speaker: TITUS'S POOL SUPPLY CART
dialogues.text: half-obscured by the heavy fooliage surrounding the court Tyrell walks away from Will toward the cart. He hears the the cart playing "TRENCHTOWN ROCK" by Bob Marley..."One g about music...when it hits you feel no pain..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The open door of the entrance CLANGS against the fence in Tyrell decides to cut through the court to the far entran cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell walks across the court to the sagging net. There is a RUSTLING in the foliage around the court. SOME fast and quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hey, Bong Marley. Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door SLAMS shut behind him. Tyrell looks back at the door. The latch seems to have st no longer swinging. Tyrell turns back toward the other door and sees The PIT BULL standing in the doorway. Tyrell stares at the dog. The do Tyrell, low and menacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill you, Bong Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simultaneously, Tyrell turns and the dog lunges forward. Tyrell sprints to the door -- it's LOCKED by a length of into the coupling. He turns to see the dog bounding at him -- Tyrell leaps up the fence just as the pit bull lunges for catches his pant leg. Tyrell kicks him away and frantical up. The dog relentlessly barks and snaps as Tyrell climbs the

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: looks in at the dog angrily charging the chain-link. He l Tyrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Jump. I've got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out to try and catch Tyrell.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FENCE
dialogues.text: Tyrell finally looses his grip and falls back, landing on He rolls quickly to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (furious) I gotta find me a pool boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla hammers the bag with a series of quick punches. She stops to catch her breath and hears a THUMPING from the o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla sticks her head out the door to the gym, listening. of the hall

dialogues.speaker: AN OPEN DOOR
dialogues.text: is visible, a single BARE BULB lighting the room. Karla m curiously toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla slowly sticks her head around the corner just as th NOISE SOUNDS LOUNDLY. She reacts --

dialogues.speaker: A THUMPING DRYER
dialogues.text: in a small laundry room. Karla relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doing Julie) Gee, Karla...That'll break the machine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She approaches the MACHINE, which is rocking with the noi KARLA (cont'd) Damn. How many pairs you got in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the dryer door and jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: A BLOODY SHOE
dialogues.text: flies out and into her arms. She looks down a beat, and S murder. A hot spray of blood gushes from the machine.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: tumbling inside the dryer. Karla SCREAMS again. Then she SOUND of heavy boots coming down the hall. She runs to th locks it. She's trapped in a bloody basement cell. Suddenly somebod the door. Karla SCREAMS. She runs across the room, shoving a folding table toward BASEMENT WINDOWS. The door is hit again and again. Somebody is throwing the against it. Karla bangs hysterically on the windows, leaving bloody h the panes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's eyes suddenly open through the GOGGLES. She thumb WALKMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. And just as Julie lies down again, Karla's frant echo down the hall. Julie goes to push open the canopy. As she does, the CANO JAMMED DOWN ON TOP OF HER. A CHAIN shoots through the han is locked on the grill. JULIE (cont'd) Karla! Somebody? Hey, this isn't funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the lights go off. Julie thrashes around, trying herself.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE PURPLE LIGHT
dialogues.text: She sees someone walking around in the room. The person s Julie could almost reach out and touch him. She begins to SCREAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell angrily makes his way past the outdoor pool bar as follows. Tyrell spots a tray of empty bottles. He picks o smashes it in half on the ground. He holds out the jagged Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do what with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell breaks another bottle in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julienne of pool boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move toward the nearby POOL HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell and Will stop outside the door. There's MUSIC from Bob Marley -- "Lively Up Yourself..." TYRELL (cont'd) I'm gonna throw the door. Get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell opens the door and charges in. Will's right behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spill into the room. A light fog hangs in the air. T them begin to COUGH and CHOKE. Titus sits on the floor facing away from them, facing a w which gray light pierces the gloom. Titus doesn't move. He's too still. In front of him is a that still SMOKES SLIGHTLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pool boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell closes the distance and kicks Titus in the back. Titus falls over like a block of wood, rictus already set His hands are bound behind him. The cord is tied off to s against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: HIS FINGERNAILS SCRATHCED GROOVES
dialogues.text: into the floor, scrabbling for the window and fresh air. Will points out two empty one-gallon PLASTIC BOTTLES.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOTTLES
dialogues.text: One is labeled CHLORINE, the other MURIATIC ACID. Will pulls Tyrell from the pool house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them collapse, COUGHING and CHOKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will splashes a puddle of rainwater on his face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's chlorine and muriatic acid. Put the two together and you get cyanide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell rolls over on his back next to Will, practically c lung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cyanide? Like poison gas? (reality dawning) You mean, somebody really killed him...Omigod. Think...Think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, they both hear KARLA SCREAMING. They sprint for building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell and Will follow Karla's CRIES to a narrow srip of window which runs along the side of the hotel. Her palms one of the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla ducks down on the table just as the window EXPLODES Tyrell kicks in the pane and looks in. TYRELL (cont'd) Give me your hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for him. He pulls her up and out through the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla tumbles to the ground with only one thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Julie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell and Will suddenly burst through the door.

dialogues.speaker: THE TANNING BED
dialogues.text: Where Julie is just visible, her fingers madly groping fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, get me out. Get me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will struggles to open the bed, but the chain holds stron Tyrell grabs a nearby dumbbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on...

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAIN
dialogues.text: Tyrell slams the barbell down, shattering the fiberglass A few of the ultraviolet tubes POP as Will yanks up on th They help Julie up, her eyes adjusting to non-purple ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost relieved) I'm not crazy...I'm not crazy. He's here... (already moving for the door) We've got to get to the radio and call for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can classify this as an emergency situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head for the manager's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst into the middle of the room before seeing that head has a machete sticking out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Brooks, listen up -- (reacting) Whoa --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell, Will, and Karla look at the radio, which is smash floor next to Brooks. Julie stares in shock at the reverse wall, at

dialogues.speaker: A STUFFED MARLIN
dialogues.text: with the words "I STILL KNOW" written on it in blood. Karla SCREAMS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody...is a sick, fingerpainting psycho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get out of here. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE POWER CUTS OUT and the hotel plunges into darkness. Julie SCREAMS and runs from the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie runs down the steps and cuts through the blowing pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie is at the end of the dock. Tears are streaming down her chest heaving. The others catch up with her. Karla realizes the boats ar Everyone is freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were boats here? Refresh my memory, there were boats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell picks up the end of a cut mooring line --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were cut loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie? Wanna tell us what is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at Julie. Their escape is cut off by water. The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking out) We're all going to die. He's going to kill us one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben Willis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not this again) Oh, stop it! He's dead. You killed him. Now, get over it. We gotta think here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never found the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice is low and urgent, an impromptu confessional. JULIE (cont'd) Two summers ago. We lied to the authorities. We hit Ben Willis with our car. Ray, me, Barry, and Helen ...We threw the body in the water to cover it up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only he wasn't dead. He killed Barry and Helen last July Fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell begins backing away from Julie. He picks up a piec driftwood from the dock. JULIE (cont'd) I thought Ray and I killed him on the boat, but we didn't and now he's back to finish up the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell holds up the log as a weapon. He's angry and afrai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on an island, miles from anywhere. I don't give a crap about you're fisherman. There's dead bodies pilling up everywhere and there's one guy missing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will moves closer to Tyrell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The porter...what's his name? Old Asbestos --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estes! That's exactly who it is. That old guy knows something. We can sit here and wait for him to pick us off or we can go find him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell turns and heads down the dock. Will goes with him. a few hesitant steps after them, then turns back toward J hasn't moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, we have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie sees her friend caught in the middle, sees her suff reluctantly starts for Karla --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) It's not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard bus folks: old people in Panama hats, buzz-cut m on holiday. Ray sits in a seat. He's in pain and does not look good. He pops a handful of pills into his mouth and washes them Orange Crush -- A dignified OLD LADY has been watching him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People live healthy in Miami. (sincere, but unsettling) It's the future down there every day of the week...The future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray slumps back, waiting for the pills to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep that in mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Estes's room BANGS inward. Tyrell, Will, Karl charge into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Freak Boy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cluttered room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell and Will begin roughly searching through Estes's p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna find some weird crap in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner there is a curtain used as a partition. Jul curtain back and discovers

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL, HEAVY CABINET
dialogues.text: sitting in the corner. It seems to glow from inside while evil pall over the room. Julie moves toward it and hesitates before opening the do Inside -- is a small voodoo shrine. A candle has burned l Hanging before the altar is

dialogues.speaker: THE LITTLE STRAW MAN
dialogues.text: impaled on a fishhook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voodoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie looks closer. She sees her toothbrush, a hair tie, other knickknacks belonging to her friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Karla) Missing a hair tie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla looks in. Tyrell snatches the straw man up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found our guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER rumbles across the sky like the judgement of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, Karla, Tyrell, and Will walk quickly down the corr have grabbed some of their things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta find flashlights, torches, guns if they got 'em, anything that'll help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Tyrell eye the stairs leading down to the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Maybe he's down there collecting the body parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Tyrell exchange a glance, an "are you man enough glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men head into the kitchen and bar area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll only be a second, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, wait right here, it's the safest place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla is terrified and waits by the stairs, but something Julie's eye. She walks across the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie keeps walking. She sees historical pictures of the crews during construction; the first limbo contest; fishe next to sailfish and marlin. Near the pictures, Julie sees the globe. It's spinning sl Julie hesitates, then walks toward the globe. It stops sp looks down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and Julie's hand finding Brazil. We see the capital is no Brazilia. This is dawning on Julie when we hear -- ESTES (v.o.) Brasilia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps out of her skin. Estes was standing right there shadows. ESTES (cont'd) That's the capital of Brazil, not Rio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla SCREAMS. Tyrell comes flying across the lobby past Karla. He dives tackling him to the floor. Will is right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go. I got him. That's me. It's him. We got you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell holds up battered Estes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's youre killer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found your voodoo crap --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake Estes, finally giving him a chance to speak. ESTES (cont'd) I found the bodies this morning...I tried to use the radio, but he already destroyed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go. I believe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Julie. You saw his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't hurt anyone...I stole those things to help you. To protect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's telling the truth. He could've easily killed me. He didn't. (beat while this sinks in) Look, we didn't even answer the radio question right...This whole thing was a setup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rio isn't the capital of Brazil. It was the wrong answer. Sorry, we lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to lose it) You've got all these theories but where is he? Where? Where's your fisherman killer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it) You never do...The guy at the nightclub, the body in your room last night. Little notes that only mean something to you. How do we even know you're not the one behind this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estes steps forward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tyrell) How do we know you're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julie) I know who you're talking about. He used to work here at the hotel. (beat) And I've seen him around again. Out in the woods by the orchard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at Estes...Is he telling the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remeber his name, but I don't forget a face. (beseeching) I can show you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare a beat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know you're not setting us up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where else you gonna go, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look to the office, the gym...The sense of death sur them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I don't want to stay in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be better off in the open. If we stick together, maybe we can kill this creep for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin moving for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish. The rain pounds a fleet of fishing boats. The securely battened down in the weather. Ray limps past, heading for a small building at the end o Its sign reads: Island Ferry, Jack Paulsen -- proprieter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gear-strewn office. Paulsen watches an episode of Party There is a loud KNOCKING at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulsen slowly gets up. He cracks the door open. Ray stan silhouetted against the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to get to Tower Bay Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulsen senses something isn't right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pushes his way in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to get there, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulsen looks at him standing there drenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you happen to notice what's going on outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls out the gun and points it at Paulsen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not looking for a weather report, I'm looking for a boat. So which one's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estes, Will, Tyrell, Julie, and Karla walk along a trail heart of the island. The storm has abated for a few minut It's windy, dark, and spooky. The kind of place you'd tak you wanted to scare them with a classic ghost story. That Estes is doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He worked here for many years. He had a nice family. A pretty wife and two little ones. A boy and a girl. They'd be about your age, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue along the path. Estes looks at them in the dark, slowing for just a secon ESTES (cont'd) One day his wife went missing. Maid found blood all over the honeymoon suite -- Room 201.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are strange NOISES out in the woods. ESTES (cont'd) Eventually, they found her body. Pieces. A leg in the swamp. An arm washed up on Three Mile Beach. (beat) And the head they found much later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge branch is blown from a tree and comes crashing dow underbrush, scaring them. Estes calmly steps around it. ESTES (cont'd) Careful --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Did he do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People say she was running around on him. People say he caught her in bed with other men. People say a lot of things. (beat) He disappeared, taking the two small ones with him. At least they were never found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The winding path leads to a small orchard. They hang on h word. ESTES (cont'd) We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the orchard is a cemetery. They move off the path into the safety of the woods. Ther activity around the place. It's silent and eerie. Julie stares, fascinated. She is slowly drawn toward the grabs for her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads, they follow, circling the house. Julie rounds the shack and stops. She sees --

dialogues.speaker: TWO TOMBSTONES
dialogues.text: The first stone reads: SARAH WILLIS (birth/death) The second stone reads: SUSIE WILLIS (birth/death) Beyond them

dialogues.speaker: A FRESHLY DUG GRAVE
dialogues.text: and the group moves slowly toward it. The headstone, part obscured by the mound of dirt, comes into view. The third headstone reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: born September 6, 1979 died July 4, 1998 "A Lying Whore"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A Lying Whore" is scratched with a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) ...Today's July fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will goes to comfort Julie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dying on this island, Will. (louder) Do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie shouts into the darkness. JULIE (cont'd) You want me, Ben Willis? Come and get me. I'm right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicks over her headstone -- JULIE (cont'd) My grave stays empty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks defiantly down the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, the boats are gone, the phones are down. There's no way off this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, we fight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks around. Estes is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd Estes go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is up with that weirdo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? He can't help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably the only one who can help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? We're not staying here on our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. He couldn't have gone far. I'll catch up with you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will disappears into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just wait here? Hide in a tree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hiding up no tree. (to Julie) I'm with her. Let's arm ourselves to the teeth and kick this psycho's butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move cautiously into the kitchen. Blue emergency lig above them. It's a big room with plenty of nooks and cran somebody to be hiding in. Tyrell picks up a couple of different knives. He hefts th hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I need is a gun. Not a steak knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla grabs a paring knife -- TYRELL (cont'd) You gonna clean vegetables? You gonna stir-fry? You need something that'll get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a huge butcher's knife and cuts the air with roughly empties other drawers looking for more weapons. Karla looks to Julie, something on her mind. Julie catche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) I'm your best friend...You could have told me the truth about what happened. I would've understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sad) Karla, I just wanted the whole thing to be over. I didn't want to involve anybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie steps over to Karla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. I brought this on everyone. It's my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell picks up on the mood swing. He moves closer to the sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget that. You didn't do nothing. This fisherman's a piece of scum. (hard for him to admit) I should've been listening to you... I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie smiles for a second. TYRELL (cont'd) Now, let's take a look at the pantry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's a good place to hide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I'm starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will runs from the trees and finds himself by an old hous Estes by the ocean, near a boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Estes. (beat) Estes? Where'd you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estes doesn't answer right away -- he keeps his back to W WILL (cont'd) You abandoning us? How come you didn't tell us you had a boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estes picks up the boat's oar. He speaks low, almost inau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has to end. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estes swings the oar, cracking Will's head hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell, Julie, and Karla approach the pantry -- a huge st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steel door...Food...Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts looking for something to eat -- CLANK. There's a soft CLATTERING from somewhere in the ro freezes, staring into the darkness. Tyrell puts a finger to his lips, then creeps down an ais listening. There's nothing but SILENCE. He moves toward the first aisle...He jumps out. The aisle

dialogues.speaker: JULIE AND KARLA
dialogues.text: move down an aisle behind him. Tyrell ducks around to the second aisle. He slices the ai pounce. This aisle is empty.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE AND KARLA
dialogues.text: nervously move another aisle down. Tyrell moves stealthily toward the third aisle...This is forward into the row...Empty, also. There's a small SOUND...A MOUSE scampers off under the sh turns and smiles at Karla and Julie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a --

dialogues.speaker: A ROLLING PIN
dialogues.text: bashes him on the back of the head. Tyrell hits the floor unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DARK FIGURE jumps down from the shelves. Tyrell puts hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling for mercy) Don't kill me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, it's Nancy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy, the bartender steps out of the shadows brandishing pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell stands at the sink, where Karla holds a towel full his head. Nancy, the bartender, looks on apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but you could've been the one doing all of this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so could you -- crazy fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stumbled into my hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have missed the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but this island didn't have a murder rate until you people showed up. (chilled) I've never seen a dead body before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) Don't even get her started...It's a long, long story and you probably wouldn't believe a word of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell moves as he talks, fed up and exhasted. He crosses stove and under a huge hanging rack of pots and pans. TYRELL (cont'd) I mean, all I know for sure is this is the worst vacation of my life... I'm tired, and I'm hungry, and I personally haven't seen one damn psycho killer...

dialogues.speaker: THWACK
dialogues.text: sinks deep into the base of Tyrell's shaved skull, a look surprise on his face. The women freeze as Tyrell dances like a marionette befor hoisted up and hung on the rack like a used saucepan.

dialogues.speaker: THE FISHERMAN
dialogues.text: is in the vent above the stove. He stares out at them fro his slicker. Ben jumps from the range onto the floor. Karla is in shoc yanks her and they flee. As she goes, Julie picks up

dialogues.speaker: A LOOSE KNIFE
dialogues.text: and hides it in her back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pilots the boat through the dark, choppy water. He's compass, maps spread before him. He sees something off th

dialogues.speaker: A BOAT
dialogues.text: drifting on the fast sea. The words "Tower Bay" are paint side. Ray pulls alongside and discovers the boat is empty He reaches for the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Come in...This is Summer Breeze requesting emergency assistance for Tower Bay island. I repeat...This is Summer Breeze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray guns the boat away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, Karla, and Nancy run into the lobby. The storm is outside the front doors. They pause for a second. Behind them we hear the rapid TH of Ben's boots. Nancy goes straight to a desk and pulls out a flashlight. to the main staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where we can hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women run up the stairs. Behind them, we hear Ben's F echoing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the top floor, they race toward the end of a dark hall At the far end of the hall, Nancy illuminates a section o ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a boost up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie helps Nancy reach a pull cord in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: A WOODEN LADDER
dialogues.text: pulls down. Nancy quickly climbs up.

dialogues.speaker: BEN WILLIS
dialogues.text: enters the hallway and continues toward them.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LADDER
dialogues.text: Karla slips, nearly knocking Julie to the floor. They bot upwards -- Ben hits the ladder -- Just as Julie reaches the top rung she SCREAMS --

dialogues.speaker: BEN'S HOOK IS ON HER FOOT
dialogues.text: Nancy appears in the opening and throws a brick down at B him in the chest and knocks him back. Julie makes it into the attic. They pull the ladder up be like a drawbridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, Karla, and Nancy surround the hatch they've just s fumble with it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way to lock it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From below comes LAUGHTER. There's a tug on the hatch, cr open. The girls pull it back shut, but it's hard to get a There's more tugging, the hatch bending down; they can se the rope SNAPS. The hatch slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way to grip this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the STEEL TIP of the HOOK pokes through the crac wriggles around...Turning...And begins to pull the hatch They try to hold it...But it's no use. They let go and ju The attic is lit by a cathedral window. It's crosshatched beams and pink insulation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your step...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK! Karla's foot goes through a gap between two beams.

dialogues.speaker: KARLA'S FOOT
dialogues.text: dangles through the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie helps Karla back up onto a beam. NANCY (cont'd) Stay on the beams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla and Julie follow her precarious progress. Ben climbs off the ladder to a beam. He watches them leap beam. His hook glints in the light. Julie, Karla, and Nancy move toward the cathedral window. They are cut off. They spread out against the wall lookin opening to get back to the hatch. Ben feints toward Nancy then swipes at Julie -- He misses. She leaps away. She looks down. Instead of ins sees a

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW INTO THE HONEYMOON SUITE
dialogues.text: She sees her bed through a one-way mirror. Julie stares, transfixed. Karla is edging her way around the side of Be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the mirror) You'd be amazed by what you'd see. My wife with every man on the island, for example. (to Julie) And you, sexy...I loved watching you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sick freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben suddenly whirls and lunges at Karla. He grabs her, bu lose their balance, teetering for a moment on one of the falling -- They CRASH through the mirror --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla and Ben hit the bed in a rain of glass. Karla bounces to her feet and dives out of the way as Ben hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla backs onto the porch. She backs up against the rail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Nancy reach the CATHEDRAL WINDOW. They open it

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: and Ben advancing toward Karla, whose back is against the Karla looks behind her, sees

dialogues.speaker: THE GLASS ROOF OF THE ORCHID HOUSE
dialogues.text: which doesn't look nealy strong enough to suppor her. Ben advances, swining the hook. Karla leaps over the rail the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla keeps a wary eye on Ben as she gingerly backs up on The GLASS begins CRACKING, subtle crack lines splintering footsteps. Ben lunges and swipes at her with his hook. Karla leans away from the attack and loses her balance, s her back on the glass. She lifts her head. Starts to move...CRACK. The glass is beneath her. She looks through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: THE ORCHIDS BELOW
dialogues.text: She tries to slide toward a support...The glass CREAKS an she moves across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) Oh, god, no --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's almost to the support when

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF EXPLODES
dialogues.text: taking Karla down into the orchid house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof shatters in an explosion of flying glass. Karla land on her back. She's unconsious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Nancy look at the empty space which once was a supporting Karla --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Karla!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben turns and looks up at Nancy and Julie. Then, he sprin balcony. Julie and Nancy duck back into the attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Nancy climb down into the hallway. They are cau expecting Ben at every turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hurry across the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling, steam-filled room, dense with vegetation of shelf after shelf of beautiful orchids. Karla lies unconscious. Slowly, she opens her eyes. There's a rustling in the flowers. She tries to get up, b She waits in terror as

dialogues.speaker: BIRDS
dialogues.text: fly up and out of the hole she's made in the roof. Karla tries to stand and her leg gives way. She tests her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oww...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla starts hobbling. She reaches the door -- it's locke other side. There is a thick glass window set in the middle of the do The cranes startle again, something upsetting them. Karla look. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Nancy arrive at the door. Karla pounds on the o points to the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's locked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy sees a KEY RING by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gotta be one of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy tries the first of many keys. Something catches Jul moves in for a closer look. Her eyes go wide --

dialogues.speaker: ORCHID HOUSE
dialogues.text: A powerful BOLT OF LIGHTNING cracks. Fills the room with bright light. BEN IS STANDING INSIDE AND HE'S HEADING STR KARLA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) He's inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla spins. Sees him. Her terrified scream blends with t now SHRIEKING VIOLENTLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy fumbles with the keys. Drops them. Julie tries to k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben closes fast, slicing the tops off orchids as he goes. bud on the tip of his hook. Karla pounds on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy fumbles for the right key but the lock is old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) It's jammed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key is stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through glass) Come on!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's running out of time. Julie sees a FIRE AXE encased safety box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determined) No way!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie smashes the glass with her elbow. Grabs the axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nancy) Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie hammers the door with the axe. Wood splinters. Glas Ben is almost on top of Karla now. Julie swings. The axe breaks the glass, pulls the frame o drops the axe. They grab Karla. Pull her through. Ben swings. The hook rips Karla's shoe, but Julie and Nan through. Julie and Ben are face to face. Julie has the axe in her stares him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, gimme a shot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben rips off his hook, eyeing Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Julie, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They flee. Ben tries the door, realizes it had locked beh can't fit through the circular window. He throws his shou the door. And again. And again. The door frame starts to give --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, Karla, and Nancy approach the iron door to the und storm cellar. Julie carries the axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They struggle together to open the heavy door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stairs lead down into darkness. Karla hesitates --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you can make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie gets in, pulling Karla in behind her. They pull the behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a light somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The darkness is complete. We hear MOVEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here. Grab my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place has emergency power. Just ease you way down the stairs and I'll find the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm at the bottom. Karla, just get my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm holding your hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nancy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy pulls the chain on an overhead bulb. The lights go illuminating

dialogues.speaker: THE DEAD CORPSES
dialogues.text: of Brooks, Derrick, Olga, and Titus -- whose hand Karla i The women SCREAM! They muddle together, trying to collect themselves. Suddenly, there is a POUNDING on the iron door. They SCRE Then, Julie remembers the axe. She motions the others to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The iron hatch is slowly opening. Julie gets the axe into

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: pokes his head through. He's clutching a piece of wood as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you guys, thank god. Is everyone okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are ecstatic to see him. They bound up the concrete

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help's here. Help's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is already on the move toward the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. We're gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shakes his head. He's walking woozily. JULIE (cont'd) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estes came after me with a gaffing hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in it with Willis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie points out that his chest and stomach are covered i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your stomach, you're hurt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks down, clutches himself, and keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was coming back I saw your slicker friend looking for you guys down by the water. (beat) Let's hurry and get inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray guns the boat straight up onto the beach. He leaps fr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will slumps down on the bar floor. He's floating in and o consciousness. Julie leans over him, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my god, you're bleeding to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back towards Nancy -- JULIE (cont'd) We need a first-aid kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already moving) I saw one in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla starts, then hesitates. Will moans, looks at her. NANCY (cont'd) I'll come with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be okay. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla and Nancy rush from the bar. Julie looks tenderly a looks back at her. She pulls some hair off his forehead. weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, just hold on. We'll get you fixed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla and Nancy go to the area near the check-in and behi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look up there. I'll look over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla looks behind the desk. Nancy is searching the shelv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie tenderly searches the area around Will's stomach. S with the clothes, looking for the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got blood everywhere, but I can't find the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes her head in his hands, looks her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because it's not my blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slow change in Julie as she realizes... She starts to run. Will roughly grabs her. WILL (cont'd) It's time you woke up, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice switches to that of a familiar radio disk jocke WILL (cont'd) (as Mark in the Morning) AND START CONTEMPLATING THE ULTIMATE MAGIC GETAWAY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags her out of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy sees a white metal box sitting on a shelf. She reac It's a first aid kit.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER HAND
dialogues.text: reaches over and lands on top of her hand. She jumps and right behind her. Karla SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will...He's in on it. He's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Estes's expression changes to surprise, and

dialogues.speaker: A SPEAR TIP
dialogues.text: appears in the front of his chest. Nancy screams and looks over Estes's shoulder to see

dialogues.speaker: BEN WILLIS
dialogues.text: standing there holding a spear gun. Estes topples over on top of Nancy, pinning her underneat convulsing body. Nancy struggles to get loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla rushes to Nancy. She tugs on her arm, trying to pul The fisherman strides toward them. He raises his hook. He Karla's head.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOOK CATCHES
dialogues.text: on a beam. Karla struggle with Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben tries to free his hook hand. Karla looks up at him. H his foot onto Estes's back and steps down with all of his driving

dialogues.speaker: THE SPEAR TIP
dialogues.text: deep into Nancy who expires with a sigh. KARLA (cont'd) Damn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karla, blind with rage, attacks the fisherman. He kicks o boot and sends Karla fying onto

dialogues.speaker: A GLASS TABLE
dialogues.text: in the lobby area. The table explodes. Karla is finished. The fisherman works his hook free from the post. Karla is looks quite dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls Julie along a muddy path in the rain. He's got hair. She's slipping and falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the bright side, Jules. We finally get to spend some quality time together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's trying to get to the knife she's stashed in her b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, me, me. It's always about you. I'm having bad dreams. I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in school. I'm having trouble with my boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trusted you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a connection, didn't we? I can tell you one thing, though. Ray didn't trust me. He was right. He's dead, but he was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come into the orchard. They are covered in mud. Juli again. Goes to her knees. Works the knife free and slashe She slices him across the face. He steps back, feels the blood. WILL (cont'd) What'd you have to do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a creepy pause. Will stares at his own blood. Sh breath... Then suddenly, Will knocks the knife from her hand. He li the hair. Enraged, he puches her in the face. She goes do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will has Julie in a choke hold. He drags her toward the o Julie is losing energy, slowly giving up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Come on, Julie. Think. You'll get it. Will Benson -- Ben's son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves her. She falls backward into the arms of Ben Wi WILL (cont'd) Hi, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie WAILS, struggling wildly in Ben's grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OMIGOD --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben holds her back to look at her. He throws back the hoo slicker. We see his face clearly for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben pulls off his hook and strokes Julie's cheek with his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shush, now. No more screaming...No more running. Time to die. RAY (v.o.) Let go of her! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Will spin to see

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: like the hero from a western, step out from behind a tree Ben starts to laugh. Will joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kiddin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do, boy? Call us names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray raises the .38 caliber handgun. He COCKS the hammer. Ben doesn't let go of Julie. Lightning fast, he slaps his and gets the point to Julie's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it, boy. You're no killer. (beat) That's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray hesitates, his finger on the trigger. He does look sc Ben takes a step toward Ray. Then another, pushing Julie him. Will moves closer, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray's finger squeezing down the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have it in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Will dives for Ray. Ray gets a shot off, taggin shoulder. The gun goes flying. Julie spins and hits Ben in the face. He knocks her into grave...Mud begins to slide in on her. She tries to scram Will and Ray wrestle, punching each other repeatedly in t Will has Ray down and his hands around his kneck. He look eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't missed you down here, Ray boy. I got to know Julie real well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will gets the better of Ray. He's stronger. He yanks him him. Ray is begging to check out. WILL (cont'd) Think of all the things I'm gonna do to her. (beat) Dad, finish him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben charges toward Ray's back. He pulls back the hook for slashing -- At the last second, Ray dips, elbows Will.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOOK
dialogues.text: goes straight into Will's chest. The fisherman has hooked his own son. Father and son make final eye contact, the son's eyes go Ben stares in shock as Will expires, falling back into th Ben SCREAMS in rage. Ray is tired. THWACK. Ben begins beating Ray. He puches him. He straigh with the hook. He knocks him again and again and Ray is b up... Ben has Ray against a tombstone. The hook slowly inches t eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna blind you first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hook is touching the eyelid --

dialogues.speaker: A GUNSHOT
dialogues.text: rings out. A look of wonder crosses Ben's face. He slowly from Ray.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: stands behind him holding the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...Die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM. BLAM. BLAM. She empties the gun into Ben, who flies into Julie's grave. As he tumbles, Ben releases the dirt stacked beside the g

dialogues.speaker: A MUDDY LANDSLIDE
dialogues.text: slowly covers Ben up. Ben's face is covering over. His mouth starting to fill w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face is completely covered. His mouth still moving. BEN (cont'd) I'll always be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dirt covers him. It continues to fill, until just the

dialogues.speaker: GLEAMING METAL HOOK
dialogues.text: waves futilely out of the dirt. Then, is stops wiggling. Julie goes to Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Julie limp across the grounds of the hotel. They past some shrubbery when

dialogues.speaker: A DARK FIGURE
dialogues.text: jumps out. Julie yells. She and Ray jump back.

dialogues.speaker: KARLA
dialogues.text: stops in the middle of her kamikaze attack, knife held ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god, it's you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay. Thank god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod. They go to her -- jubilant group hug time. They themselves. KARLA (cont'd) You know, it's true what they say about package vacations...You get what you pay for. (beat) Now, how about we get off this piece of crap island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rays of the morning sun appear. Ray looks adori as the beautific light catches her face. Ray kisses her. She kisses him back. They are silhouetted beautiful orange sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) We don't have to tell anyone it rained the whole time. It can just be our little secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them throw their arms around each other's sh they start walking for the beach as...

dialogues.speaker: A COAST GUARD HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: rises into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish. The sun setting over a quaint street in a coll

dialogues.speaker: SUPERTITLE
dialogues.text: Julie pedals her bicycle down the street. She has a book shoulder. It feels like one of the first days of school. She rides the bike up to a small house on the perfect str rolls the bike right up to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie lets herself into the house. She leans her bike aga bike in the hallway. It's a perfect day. Birds CHIRPING. WIND in the willows. another NOISE...from inside her house. She goes perfectly still. And listens. Behind her, by the shadow of a FIGURE moves. She whirls.

dialogues.speaker: NOTHING
dialogues.text: She creeps down the hallway toward her kitchen. She pause The dark figure almost knocks into her. She SCREAMS. It's Ray. He's holding a disemboweled toaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray...what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (toaster) Oh...it's not working right. You're home early. (sees she's shaken) Did I scare you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never do that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tender) Hey -- I didn't know you were here. It's okay. (beat) We got the refrigerator in. Come see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the love in his eyes. She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie climbs to the top of the stairs. She passes Ray in She pauses in the doorway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is at the sink in boxer shorts. He's using an electri devicice that has just been opened, a gift from the party low WHIRRING sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing her) Checking the locks again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me to well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie smile and walks to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie climbs into bed with a book. The bedroom is clean a The windows are closed. The closet door is shut. The room is decorated simply: a high antique bed; unopene highboy; an antique mirror leaning against the wall. A st sits in a chair. There is a CLATTER from another room. Julie freezes. She hears it again. She climbs out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie walks into the dark spare bedroom. The CLATTERING S from the open window. The wind is blowing the blinds. Julie relaxes. She shuts the window. As she leaves the ro the dirty imprint of a boot below the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie passes Ray who is still absorbed with the new toy. Behind him, the door softly closes. The lock twists. Ray happy being the dental-hygene pacesetter of the household

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie enters the room. She looks at the closet door. It i crack. She hesitates, trying to remember if it was open b wasn't. Julie approaches the closet. She catches her refelction i next to the closet. She peers into the crack of the close see anything. She throws open the closet door.

dialogues.speaker: NOTHING
dialogues.text: She looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is my problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down on the bed. We see her bare feet from under the bed. She smiles, relaxes. She looks in the mirror leaning agai Something has caught her eye. She freezes. She turns slow the reflection in the mirror. She sees the glint of steel

dialogues.speaker: THE FISHERMAN CROUCHING UNDER HER BED
dialogues.text: Julie turns too late -- The fisherman lunges out and grabs her legs. Julie scream down -- Her nails scrape into the wooden floor as she is dragged bed.
